A36: Im keeping a close eye on the FCC, and working with pro-consumer advocates to make sure that the internet remains a level playing field
Q36: what are you doing to defend Title II net neutrality?
A35: We must cont to support our unions & workers’ rights & protect workers who choose to organize, that’s why I’ve cosponsored the WAGE Act
Q35: What can we do to prevent the US from becoming a right-to-work country?
A34: We must work with our allies and use all diplomatic options to reduce tensions
Q34: What should the US's next steps be in relation to North Korea?
A33: Overturning an existing ruling is very difficult but we should be very concerned about how this new court will rule
Q33: How concerned should we be about the Supreme Court overturning some of the more progressive rulings?
A32: House has no say over senate rules. Americans should make their outrage at this behavior clear. Call. Write Letters. Tweet & Facebook.
Q32: What can be done to prevent the senate from changing more voting rules?
A31: Im fighting 4 policies to reduce carbon emissions & address threat of climate change. Carbon fee should be a part of that conversation
Q31: Do you support a carbon fee proposal?
A30: Yes, I'm working on getting a GOP colleague to join with me, which the caucus requires.
Q30: Are you going to join the Bipartisan Climate Solutions Caucus?
A29: Yes, and that is how Dems will achieve anything without a majority in house or senate. We must strive to be bipartisan where we can
Q29: Can you work with moderate republicans who recognize that the Trump administration's policies are harmful to the majority of Americans?
A28: I'm a cosponsor of Voting Rights Advancement Act which would restore protections of the VRA. NY also needs more access to early voting!
Q28: What specifically are you doing to protect and expand voting rights for all Americans? What can an everyday citizen do to help?
A27: I support stronger campaign finance reform & overturning Citizens United. Corps r prohibited frm donating directly 2 federal candidates
Q27: What can be done about the undue influence of corporate/billionaire money in politics?
A26: I'm fighting to make sure it isn't ended. It's a great way to get best/brightest working in gov & non-profit where we need their minds
Q26: If the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program gets overturned, how should changes be grandfathered in to protect constituents?
A25: I've been pushing for reimbursement since the beginning. Talking w Rs in cong. Holding press events so the issue stays in the limelight
Q25: What are you doing to ensure that NYers/NYPD are reimbursed for costs related to protecting Pres. Trump and his family here in NYC?
A24: encourage and fund education in growing fields so that our workforce has skills that cannot be replicated by machines
Q24: What can we do to protect/replace jobs that will be lost to technological advances and automation?
A23: Dodd-Frank reforms have helped protect against predatory lenders on Wall Street. Im fighting to protect these reforms from #GOP attacks
Q23: What are you doing to protect Americans from predatory college loans/wall street?
A22: more than I can fit in 140 characters. I've rallied, introduced legislation, written letters, spoken publicly against his actions.
Q22: What specific actions have you taken to oppose the Trump agenda?
A21: Protect the DREAM program. Create a path to citizenship for them. Keep families together.
Q21: How can we help undocumented youth?
A20: Be vocal in your support. Keep pushing #GOP to move it.
Q20: What can we do to get the BRIDGE Act passed?
A19: I will be voting against it. Medical bills of the victims in from medical malpractice cases can get far more expensive than $250k.
Q19: How are you going to vote on HR1215, which would create a federal limit of $250k for settlements of medical malpractice suits?
A18: Pushing for infrastructure investments & money for the Community Development Financial Institutions fund, to help local biz, and more.
Q18: What are you doing to help grow and stimulate the local economy?
A17: right now it's a fight just to keep funding in #HUD. We need to prevent cuts and support incentives for new units.
Q17: What are we doing to speed up the production of new housing units to help keep housing costs down?
A16: there is very little chance that we will face a constitutional convention. If we do, the liberal states will need to work together.
Q16: What can we do about the possibility of a constitutional convention that has the potential to change the constitution for the worse?
A15: I will fight so a boarder wall is never built. I will work closely w/ MTA to ensure 2nd Ave Subway is built by appropriate companies.
Q15: What are you doing to ensure construction from 2nd Ave Subway and a boarder wall don't benefit Trump/private businesses?
A14: I don't decide how to vote on a bill until I can read the legislation through. Strengthening our infrastructure is a top priority.
Q14: How will you vote on proposed infrastructure plans?
A13: NYC is a sanctuary city and ICE has no standing to use NYID info for their own cases. It would be abhorrent to turn them over.
Q13: What are you doing to prevent info from NYID applications getting to ICE?
A12: I’m pushing legislation to protect funding for sanctuary cities so we aren’t unfairly punished for protecting our citizens.
Q12: What are you doing to protect sanctuary cities?

A11: Know your rights. Every1 has the right to a lawyer. B informed share w loved ones. Good info frm @AILANational: http://www.aila.org/advo-media/tools/psas/know-your-rights-handouts-if-ice-visits …
Q11: How can we keep noncriminal undocumented immigrants, who cannot be deported, out of ICE detention? What r concrete actions we can take?
A10: I will do all I can to protect funding for programs for our children. They are essential for many families across the city.
Q10: How r u protecting the 21st CenturyCommunityLearningCentersprogram providing $87mil 4 afterschool/summer programming in NYS 4 60k kids?
A9: The US government isn’t paying the president’s legal fees. He is costing the taxpayers millions in other fees (ex: travel)
Q9: Can anything be done about the U.S. government (ie: US taxpayers) footing Pres. Trump's legal fees?
A8: Democrats need to stay united to exploit #GOP fractures and use our voices to stand against assaults on our rights.
Q8: What kind of powers, however limited, do democrats have as a double-minority party in Congress?
A7: I do. Its important our students get accurate sex-ed to be ready for adult situations. Harassment & consent edu help keep everyone safe
Q7: Do you support better sex education in public schools? Specifically more on sexual harassment and consent
A6: We must hold Dept of Ed accountable to our laws & regs & continue to support our public schools by bettering America’s education system
Q6: What sort of plan do you have to ensure equity in the public school system?
A5: We can keep building momentum here in New York and show the country that a restorative—not punitive—justice system can make us safer.
Q5: What can we do to move critical criminal justice reform ahead? Are there specific initiatives that we can support?
A4: ID theft is a real challenge & we all need to be careful. You can get  some tips herehttps://www.ftc.gov/news-events/media-resources/protecting-consumer-privacy …
Q4: How can we protect ourselves from discrimination in job searches, ID theft, etc. now that hacking & information selling is so prevalent?
A3: Yes I am, and I’m proud to do so.
Q3: Are you co-sponsoring HR 676, Expanded and Improved Medicare for All? If not, why not?
A2: I voted no. The bill actually hurts the #EPA, tries to stop them from using scientific research unless raw data is publicly available.
Q2: Can you clarify your vote on HR1430 and why are dems so split on this bill?
A1: I am supporting efforts to allow early voting and vote by mail in NY, as well as more polling sites
Q1: New York ranks 41st out of 50 states in voter participation, what are you doing to extend the vote to all those who have the right?
